hook.text: Your toddler always reaches with her left hand. Is she left-handed already?

buildup.text: Hand preference usually stabilizes between ages two and four.

discovery.text: Handedness reflects brain lateralization â€” one hemisphere becomes dominant for motor tasks.

twist.text: Only 10% of humans are left-handed, and that ratio has held for 500,000 years.

climax.text: Forcing a switch can cause stuttering and frustration. The brain knows what it prefers.

punchline.text: The hand chooses the child, not the reverse.
